title: Tactile Systems Technology Second Quarter 2025 Earnings: Beats Expectations
description: NasdaqGM:TCMD 1 Year Share Price vs Fair Value Explore Tactile Systems Technology's Fair Values from the Community and...
content:
Explore Tactile Systems Technology's Fair Values from the Community and select yours
• Profit margin: 4.1% (down from 5.9% in 2Q 2024). The decrease in margin was driven by higher expenses.
• EPS: US$0.14 (down from US$0.18 in 2Q 2024).

This technology could replace computers: discover the 20 stocks are working to make quantum computing a reality.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Revenue exceeded analyst estimates by 6.7%. Earnings per share (EPS) also surpassed analyst estimates by 30%.

Looking ahead, revenue is forecast to grow 8.6% p.a. on average during the next 3 years, compared to a 8.2% growth forecast for the Medical Equipment industry in the US.

The company's shares are up 22% from a week ago.

Before you take the next step you should know about the 2 warning signs for Tactile Systems Technology that we have uncovered.

keywords.name: Tactile Systems Technology Second Quarter 2025 Earnings

summary: Tactile Systems Technology's Q2 2025 earnings exceeded analyst estimates by 6.7% and its earnings per share (EPS) surpassed analyst forecasts by 30%. The company's profit margin was reduced to 4.1%, driven by higher expenses, and its EPS was also reduced to US$0.14 (down from 2Q 2024). Looking ahead, revenue is expected to grow 8.6% p.a. on average over the next three years, compared to a 8.2% growth forecast for the Medical Equipment industry in the US. The company’s shares are up 22% from a week ago.
shortSummary: Tactile Systems Technology's Q2 earnings beat expectations, despite a 4.1% profit margin drop, with forecasted growth of 8.6% per year.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1995 | 1,037 | Sheri Dodd | tactilemedical.com |
Tactile Systems Technology, Inc., a medical technology company, develops and provides medical devices to treat underserved chronic diseases in the United States. It offers Flexitouch Plus system, a pneumatic compression device for the treatment of lymphedema in the home setting; and Entre Plus System, a portable pneumatic compression device for the at-home treatment of venous disorders, such as lymphedema and chronic venous insufficiency, including venous leg ulcers. The company also provides Nimbl, a pneumatic compression platform for the treatment of upper extremity lymphedema; Kylee, a mobile application to help patients learn about lymphedema, track their symptoms, and treatment, as well as to share their progress with their doctor; and AffloVest, a portable high frequency chest wall oscillation vest to treat patients with retained pulmonary secretions resulting from bronchiectasis, cystic fibrosis, and various neuromuscular disorders.

argos_summary: Tactile Systems Technology (TCMD) reported a profit margin decrease to 4.1% and earnings per share (EPS) of $0.14, both down from the previous quarter. Despite these declines, revenue exceeded analyst estimates by 6.7%, and EPS surpassed expectations by 30%. The company forecasts an average revenue growth of 8.6% per annum over the next three years, slightly above the industry average, while its shares have risen 22% recently, although there are two warning signs identified for potential investors.
